meanings.definition: A device that reads and converts printed text or graphic material into a digital format.
meanings.sent1: The scanners at the library help turn books into digital files.
meanings.sent2: I used the scanners at work to make copies of important documents.
meanings.sent3: The scanners in the office were so busy, they started chatting with each other.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like scanners, quickly capturing every detail in the room.
meanings.sent5: The scanners hummed softly as they transformed the paper into pixels.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that scans or examines something closely.
meanings.sent1: The security guard acted like a human scanners, checking everyone who entered.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was a scanners, noticing even the smallest mistakes in the students' work.
meanings.sent3: The scanners in the group project were the ones who found the hidden clues.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like scanners, analyzing every detail of the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The scanners of the art piece revealed hidden symbols beneath the paint.

meanings.definition: A device that detects radio signals, such as police scanners.
meanings.sent1: The police officers used scanners to listen in on emergency calls.
meanings.sent2: The scanners in the car helped them find the nearest radio station.
meanings.sent3: The scanners at the station were so old, they picked up signals from the past.
meanings.sent4: His intuition acted like scanners, picking up on the subtle changes in the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The scanners crackled with static as they searched for the lost signal.
